member.name: T:bbv.Common.Windows.GraphicHelper
member.summary: Provides functionality for access graphical information.

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Windows.GraphicHelper.GetDpi
member.summary: Calculates the DPI of the windows desktop.

member.name: T:bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper
member.summary: Provides functionality to interact with Windows (OS).

member.name: M:bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper.ExitSystem(bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper.EWX_ENUM)
member.summary: Shuts down the machine according the given value.
member.param: Set of flags defined in EWX_ENUM

member.name: T:bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper.EWX_ENUM
member.summary: Flags to tell how to Exit the system.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper.EWX_ENUM.EWX_LOGOFF
member.summary: Shuts down all processes running in the logon session of the process that called the ExitWindowsEx function. Then it logs the user off. This flag can be used only by processes running in an interactive user's logon session.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper.EWX_ENUM.EWX_SHUTDOWN
member.summary: Shuts down the system to a point at which it is safe to turn off the power. All file buffers have been flushed to disk, and all running processes have stopped. The calling process must have the SE_SHUTDOWN_NAME privilege. For more information, see the following Remarks section. Specifying this flag will not turn off the power even if the system supports the power-off feature. You must specify EWX_POWEROFF to do this. Windows XP SP1: If the system supports the power-off feature, specifying this flag turns off the power.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper.EWX_ENUM.EWX_REBOOT
member.summary: Shuts down the system and then restarts the system. The calling process must have the SE_SHUTDOWN_NAME privilege. For more information, see the following Remarks section.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper.EWX_ENUM.EWX_POWEROFF
member.summary: Shuts down the system and turns off the power. The system must support the power-off feature. The calling process must have the SE_SHUTDOWN_NAME privilege. For more information, see the following Remarks section.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper.EWX_ENUM.EWX_FORCE
member.summary: Forces processes to terminate. When this flag is set, the system does not send the WM_QUERYENDSESSION and WM_ENDSESSION messages. This can cause the applications to lose data. Therefore, you should only use this flag in an emergency. Windows XP: If the computer is locked and this flag is not specified, the shutdown process will fail.

member.name: F:bbv.Common.Windows.WindowsHelper.EWX_ENUM.EWX_FORCEIFHUNG
member.summary: Forces processes to terminate if they do not respond to the WM_QUERYENDSESSION or WM_ENDSESSION message within the timeout interval. For more information, see the Remarks. This flag is ignored if EWX_FORCE is used. Windows NT and Windows Me/98/95: This value is not supported.
